title: A 10 Year Review
introduction: To celebrate our 10th anniversary, we would like to look back at our activities and highlights over the past 10 years. This review serves as documentation, inspiration and basis for the next 10 years of Opendata.ch in Switzerland. Thank you all for joining us on this journey for an open, innovative and fair society.

texts.text: First open data conference in Switzerland.

texts.alt: Visual of the first Opendata.ch conference in 2011, showing the Federal Palace opened as if it was a box.

texts.text: First Hackathon (at the time called Open Data Camp) in Switzerland.
Make opendata - so hiess das Motto für über 100 Techies, Designer und weitere Interessierte während zwei Tagen an der Hochschule der Künste in Zürich und an der ETH Lausanne.
Foundation of the association Opendata.ch on January 19th in Bern.
Our association started with 94 members and over 300 newsletter subscribers.
First time Rufus Pollock, founder of Open Knowledge International, speaks in Switzerland at our conference.

texts.alt: Open Data Camp Transport workshop, 2012, showing a group of people in a room with chairs and tables, two of them pointing at a white board with sticky notes.

texts.text: At the Open Transport Data Hackdays a team develops the basis of the “Touch” timetable, which is integrated into the SBB app later on.
First open knowledge conference in Switzerland.
Wir stehen damit für ein paar Tage im Brennpunkt der gesamten internationalen Open Data Community und erwarten mehrere hundert Gäste aus über 50 Ländern.
Launch of opendata.admin.ch, the first Open Government Data (OGD) portal of the Swiss state.
The National Council approved the OGD master plan postulate.

Launch of the Swiss OpenGLAM Working Group, bringing together representatives of heritage institutions, NGOs, research and education, and service providers, in order to promote and facilitate the adoption of the OpenGLAM Principles in Switzerland.
Federal Council adopts OGD Strategy 2014 - 2018.
Launch of the OpenGLAM and Open Transport working groups.
Our association had more than 200 members.
Launch of School of Data to support the usage and understanding of data.
We developed a parliamentary proposal to call for a legal basis for OGD.
Le premier marathon voué au traitement des documents culturels numériques se tient ce week-end à Berne.
First round table about OGD in Switzerland.
Launch of the Open Food Data working group.
Eine App, welche Konsumenten beim Einkaufen hilft oder den Inhalt eines Bieres auf Molekularstufe analysiert: Dies sind zwei der Projekte, die am Wochenende [...] erarbeitet wurden.
Adoption of the second OGD Strategy 2019 - 2023 by the Federal Council.
First time we organized an unconference, an event where participants co-determine the program.
Launch of the awareness campaign Data Café.
Launch of the incubation program Prototype Fund.
First time we co-organised a national online Hackathon with over 4000 participants (VersusVirus).
Versusvirus.ch, un sito per trovare soluzioni pratiche al Covid-19.
A project at the Open Energy Data Hackdays initiates the integration of Switzerland in the Electricity Map platform: Energeia.
Launch of the awareness campaign Data Café in Romandie.
First long-term partnership with the Federal Department of Home Affairs.
First time Opendata.ch was mentioned on national tv.

future_text: What might lie ahead? Share your thoughts with us about the future of open knowledge in Switzerland and become a member to join our journey. If you are already a member: a big thank you for your continuous support!
